title: Travel and tourism 's direct contribution to employment worldwide 2016 - 2017 , by region
summary: This grouped bar chart shows Employment in millions on the Y-axis for 13 different Regions for 2 groups 2016, and 2017 that are presented on the X-axis.
For Region North East Asia, 2017 had the highest Employment in millions 3049.0 among the 2 groups and in Central Asia, 2017 had the lowest Employment in millions 38.0.
Region South Asia and Central Asia had the biggest gap of 2809.0 between the highest and lowest Employment in millions found for 2016.
Averaging all 2 groups 2016, and 2017, the Region South Asia is the maximum Employment in millions and Central Asia is the minimum Employment in millions.
min_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 13 different Regions on X-axis for 2 groups 2016, and 2017. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Employment in millions.
For Region North East Asia, 2017 had the highest Employment in millions 3049.0 among the 2 groups and in Central Asia, 2017 had the lowest Employment in millions 38.0.
mid_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Employment in millions on the Y-axis for 13 different Regions for 2 groups 2016, and 2017 that are presented on the X-axis.
For Region North East Asia, 2017 had the highest Employment in millions 3049.0 among the 2 groups and in Central Asia, 2017 had the lowest Employment in millions 38.0.
Region South Asia and Central Asia had the biggest gap of 2809.0 between the highest and lowest Employment in millions found for 2016.
Averaging all 2 groups 2016, and 2017, the Region South Asia is the maximum Employment in millions and Central Asia is the minimum Employment in millions.
max_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 13 different Regions on X-axis for 2 groups 2016, and 2017. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Employment in millions.
Region North East Asia had the maximum Employment in millions among all 2 groups, and it was for 2017. The minimum Employment in millions was observed in Region Central Asia for 2017.
For Region South Asia, 2016 had the maximum Employment in millions and it saw the lowest in Region Central Asia out of all 13 Regions.
Region South Asia and Central Asia had the biggest gap of 2809.0 between the highest and lowest Employment in millions found for 2016.
Out of all 2 groups, the highest gap between the maximum and minimum Employment in millions was found in case of 2016.
Averaging all 2 groups 2016, and 2017, the Region South Asia is the maximum Employment in millions and Central Asia is the minimum Employment in millions.
